A Prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord, thou hast been our dwelling place in all generations.<RF>A Prayer…: or, A Prayer, being a Psalm of Moses<Rf><RF>in…: Heb. in generation and generation<Rf>
Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou <FI>art<Fi> God.
Thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, Return, ye children of men.
For a thousand years in thy sight <FI>are but<Fi> as yesterday when it is past, and <FI>as<Fi> a watch in the night.<RF>when…: or, when he hath passed them<Rf>
Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are <FI>as<Fi> a sleep: in the morning <FI>they are<Fi> like grass <FI>which<Fi> groweth up.<RF>groweth…: or, is changed<Rf>
In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.<CM>
For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.
Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret <FI>sins<Fi> in the light of thy countenance.
For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: we spend our years as a tale <FI>that is told<Fi>.<RF>passed…: Heb. turned away<Rf><RF>as a…: or, as a meditation<Rf>

The days of our years <FI>are<Fi> threescore years and ten; and if by reason of strength <FI>they be<Fi> fourscore years, yet <FI>is<Fi> their strength labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.<RF>The days…: Heb. As for the days of our years, in them are seventy years<Rf>
Who knoweth the power of thine anger? even according to thy fear, <FI>so is<Fi> thy wrath.<CM>
So teach <FI>us<Fi> to number our days, that we may apply <FI>our<Fi> hearts unto wisdom.<RF>apply: Heb. cause to come<Rf>
Return, O LORD, how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy servants.
O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
Make us glad according to the days <FI>wherein<Fi> thou hast afflicted us, <FI>and<Fi> the years <FI>wherein<Fi> we have seen evil.
Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy glory unto their children.
And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.<CM>
